title.narrative: Towards a professional malt barley and wheat marketing organization

description.narrative:
Raya Kejewa Multipurpose Cooperative Farmers Unions is a multipurpose union established in 2008. The union has 31 cooperative societies as member. The union has a track record in input marketing, output marketing performance is low.
The area has excellent conditions for malt barley production. In the 2011/2012 season more than 100 tons of malt barley was produced in the Kofele district. Although it appears that the union has the capacity to mobilize primary cooperatives, it lacks working capital to purchase malt barley and due to weak management in 2012 no malt barley was traded by the union. The union stated that margins on wheat trading are minimal.
In 2012 general manager as well as almost all staff members have been renewed. Former employees didn’t perform well and there were irregularities with cash management. The current staff is said to perform well. The general manager, employed since 2012, is proud of achievements such as construction of new office, achieved support by Self Help Africa, wrote a proposal for ACDIVOCA for construction of warehouse, no cases of fraud occurred, no corruption and net profit of ETB in 2012.
The relation with PCs is considered as weak. Main reason is that union is not able to meet expectations regarding purchase and marketing of products due to shortage of working capital. However, members value the service of inputs distribution.
Raya Kejewa is a multipurpose union, with a focus on malt barley and wheat. Their focus is mainly on input marketing and the union seeks to enhance its performance in output marketing. The company assessment showed that especially the linkage with the Primary Cooperative Societies (PCS) is very weak and that the PCS are more input marketing oriented. Only 2 out of the PCS are actively involved in output marketing in collaboration with the union. Reason for the low performance of union and PCS is the weak relation between PCS and union and the low awareness of PCS what the union can do for them. This action plan focusses on strengthening the PCS-union linkage as well as professionalizing the union in its output marketing performance, financial management, acquisition of sufficient work capital and business plan development.
Objectives of the action plan in brief are: - Strengthening the transaction relation between the primary cooperative societies and the union - Professionalizing the unions trade capacity and important supportive systems as financial management, membership database and human resource management - Acquiring working capital and improving output marketing performance.
- Strengthening the transaction relation between the primary cooperative societies and the union - Professionalizing the unions trade capacity and important supportive systems as financial management, membership database and human resource management - Acquiring working capital and improving output marketing performance.
